page.title: 06LANDSCAPE/MIDDLETON
page.content: One hundred years ago,the population of Middleton was approx.150.As far as the records show,the village comprised about a dozen farms,a dozen cottages,a blacksmiths shop,a toffee shop and a school.The latter was the Ancient Free Grammar School,built in 1849,though the original building went back to the early 17th Century,and a Dames School Nowadays the population is housed in Council houses,modern semis,bungalows, and restored and renovated cottages. Pontins Holiday Camp and 4 large caravan parks,cater for a holiday population who enjoy the proximity to Morecambe and the vast expanse of Middleton Sands,still privately owned by a family with long connections with the area. The Heysham Industrial Estate,and the Nuclear Power Plant,provide many jobs.
